description: How do Cubans view their past, and how does this shape their understanding of the present?
This course focuses on the 1959 Revolution and historical memory. Students explore through
visits to museums, memorials, and monuments how the government has sought to influence the
ways Cubans remember the revolution and the later turn toward socialism. Students also study
present-day Cuba through visits to health clinics, cooperatives, and schools, as well as lectures
from local experts. Offered during Interim in alternate years.  Counts toward Latin American
